twig.Leaf scar arrangement: there are two leaf scars per node on the stem or twig
twig.Leaves per node: there are two leaves per node along the stem
twig.Leaf arrangement: opposite: there are two leaves per node along the stem
twig.Lenticels on twigs: there are clearly lenticels on the twigs
twig.Pith type: the pith inside the twig is solid, completely filled with spongy tissue
twig.Twig bloom: there is no bloom on the twig
twig.Twig scales: there are no scales on the twig surface

Winter bud shape: the winter buds are lanceoloid (lance-shaped, widest below the middle and tapering to the ends)
Winter bud stalks: the winter buds have no stalks
the winter buds have short stalks

flower.Enlarged sterile flowers: there are no enlarged sterile flowers on the plant
flower.Flower symmetry: there are two or more ways to evenly divide the flower (the flower is radially symmetrical)
Inflorescence type: the inflorescence differs from the choices given
the inflorescence is a fascicle (compact cluster of flowers)
the inflorescence is an umbel (with an axis so short it appears the flowers all originate from the same point)
flower.Petal and sepal arrangement: the flower includes two cycles of petal- or sepal-like structures
flower.Petal appearance: the petals are thin and delicate, and pigmented (colored other than green or brown)

fruit.Fruit type (general): the fruit is dry and splits open when ripe
Fruit type (specific): the fruit is a schizocarp (when dry it splits into sections, each holding one or more seeds)
the fruit is an achene (dry, usually 1-seeded, does not separate or split open at maturity)
fruit.Wings on fruit: the fruit has one or more wings on it

general.Sap color: the sap is clear and watery

habit.Branch cross-section: the branch is circular in cross-section, or it has five or more sides, so that there are no sharp angles

leaf_blade.Leaf blade base shape: The base of the leaf blade is cordate (heart-shaped, with rounded lobes)
leaf_blade.Leaf blade base symmetry: the leaf blade base is symmetrical
leaf_blade.Leaf blade bloom: there is a noticeable powdery or waxy bloom on the underside of the leaf
leaf_blade.Leaf blade edges: the edge of the leaf blade has lobes, or it has both teeth and lobes
leaf_blade.Leaf blade edges (Acer): the leaves have teeth throughout the leaf blade, including between the lobes
leaf_blade.Leaf blade flatness: the leaf is flat (planar) at the edges
Leaf blade hairs: the hairs on the leaf blade are different from the choices given
leaf_blade.Leaf blade scales: there are no scales on the leaf blades
Leaf blade shape: the leaf blade is orbicular (roughly circular, as wide as long)
the leaf blade is ovate (widest below the middle and broadly tapering at both ends)
the leaf blade is triangular, with the stalk or attachment point on one of the sides
leaf_blade.Leaf blade texture: the leaf blade is herbaceous (has a leafy texture)
leaf_blade.Leaf blade translucent dots: there are no translucent dots on the leaf blade
leaf_blade.Leaf blade vein pattern: the main veins of the leaf blade are palmate (radiate out from the base, like a hand)
leaf_blade.Leaf blade veins: the leaf blade has three or more main veins running from the base (or near the base) towards the tip
Hairs on underside of leaf blade: the underside of the leaf has hairs on it
the underside of the leaf has no hairs
leaf_blade.Hairs on upper side of leaf blade: the upper side of the leaf is not hairy, or has very few hairs
leaf_blade.Leaf form: the plant is broad-leaved (with broadly flattened leaf blades)
Leaf teeth: the leaf blade margin is crenate (with rounded teeth) or crenulate (with tiny, rounded teeth)
the leaf blade margin is serrate (with forward-pointing) or dentate (with outward-pointing) with medium-sized to coarse teeth
leaf_blade.Leaf type: the leaf blade is simple (i.e., lobed or unlobed but not separated into leaflets)
leaf_blade.Specific leaf type: the leaves are simple (i.e., lobed or unlobed but not separated into leaflets

leaf_stalk.Leaf stalk attachment to leaf: the petiole attaches at the basal margin of the leaf blade
leaf_stalk.Leaf stalk nectaries: there are no nectaries on the leaf stalk
leaf_stalk.Leaf stalk shape: the leaf stalk is not flattened

leaf.Leaf duration: the leaves drop off in winter (or they wither but persist on the plant)
leaf.Stipules: there are no stipules on the plant, or they fall off as the leaf expands

Plant odor: the plant does not have much of an odor, or it has an unpleasant or repellant odor

Bark texture: the bark of an adult plant is ridged or plated
the bark of an adult plant is thin and smooth

Wings on branch: the branch does not have wings on it
armature on plant: the plant does not have spines, prickles, or thorns
